Description: Fragment of long, narrow tapestry panel (grouped warp threads) in undyed linen and red wool and plain weave; Design of a row of fourteen hearts, with a border of small flower and plant motifs at right angles beneath; Selvedge at left side, upper and lower edges turned under; Originally sewn to the neck or hem of a tunic; Warp: S spun linen, c.16tpc paired for tapestry; Weft: S spun wool and linen, c.10tpc in plain areas and c.42tpc in tapestry; Edges: one simple selvedge, other edges cut; Sewing: along folds, hemming in S spun Z ply linen
Curator's comments: Unreg 100; Previous location cupboard P; Appears to have been woven to be applied; Note direction of warp in relation to design-if from a woven to shape tunic warp should have run lengthways; Information from Hero granger-Taylor (11.2.1992)
Condition: Fair; Discoloured and linen rotten in places
